Safely execute a SQL query with automatic retry

func_try_fetch.Rd

This function attempts to execute a SQL query using DBI::dbSendQuery() and DBI::dbFetch(), with automatic retries in case of transient database failures such as connection loss or query preparation errors.

Usage

func_try_fetch(con, sql, max_attempts = 10, wait_seconds = 1, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

con

A DBI connection object.

sql

A SQL query string, typically created using glue::glue_sql().

max_attempts

Integer. Maximum number of attempts before giving up. Default is 10.

wait_seconds

Numeric. Time in seconds to wait between retries. Default is 1.

verbose

Logical. If TRUE, displays informative messages. Default is TRUE.

Value

A tibble containing the query results, with unique column names.

Details

This function is designed for read queries (e.g., SELECT) that return results. For write queries (e.g., UPDATE, INSERT, DELETE), use a variant that uses dbExecute() or dbSendStatement().

If the database connection is lost, the function stops immediately. If the query fails to prepare (e.g., due to a lock or temporary issue), the function retries up to max_attempts.
